latestVersion.versionNote: Updated syntax file for R 3.0.0 and Zelig 4.1-3

fields.value: Replication data for: Bolsa Família and the Shift in Lula’s Electoral Base, 2002-2006

authorAffiliation.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

dsDescriptionValue.value: Includes web-appendix with extended results, data, and replication code for the analysis presented in the paper.

publicationCitation.value: Zucco, Cesar and Power, Timothy. 2013. "Bolsa Família and the Shift in Lula’s Electoral Base, 2002-2006: A Reply to Bohn." Latin American Research Review, 48(2).

files.description: (R Data File) This file contains predicted vote for Lula in 2002 and 2006 as estimated from LAPOP 2006. It is called by _replic_20022006.R to compare estimates from LAPOP 2007 with other surveys. It can be produced from code in _replic.R, provided the original LAPOP data file is available.
files.label: predictedvoteLULA_LAPOP2007.Rdta

dataFile.description: (R Data File) This file contains predicted vote for Lula in 2002 and 2006 as estimated from LAPOP 2006. It is called by _replic_20022006.R to compare estimates from LAPOP 2007 with other surveys. It can be produced from code in _replic.R, provided the original LAPOP data file is available.

files.description: (R syntax file, updated to R 3.0.0 and Zelig 4.1-3) This file contains the code to analyze and produce graphs of the predicted vote for Lula in 2002 and 2006, according to different surveys, as well a figure of the relationship between human development index and vote for Lula in 2002 and 2006. Uses data file _replic_20022006.RData and predictedvoteLULA_LAPOP2007.Rdta
files.label: _replic_20022006_1.R

dataFile.description: (R syntax file, updated to R 3.0.0 and Zelig 4.1-3) This file contains the code to analyze and produce graphs of the predicted vote for Lula in 2002 and 2006, according to different surveys, as well a figure of the relationship between human development index and vote for Lula in 2002 and 2006. Uses data file _replic_20022006.RData and predictedvoteLULA_LAPOP2007.Rdta

files.description: (R Data file) This file contains a list in which each of the six elements is a matrix with selected variables from public opinion surveys taken close to the 2002 and 2006 elections. Each survey is identified in the file, and includes the following variables: codeibge (official code of the municipality from which respondent was samples), vote (vote intention), income, partyID, educ (education level), sex, age,  region, surv (name and year of the survey), hdi.2000 (human development index of municipality), we (survey weights). Municipality information is only available for four of the six surveys.
files.label: _replic_20022006.RData

dataFile.description: (R Data file) This file contains a list in which each of the six elements is a matrix with selected variables from public opinion surveys taken close to the 2002 and 2006 elections. Each survey is identified in the file, and includes the following variables: codeibge (official code of the municipality from which respondent was samples), vote (vote intention), income, partyID, educ (education level), sex, age,  region, surv (name and year of the survey), hdi.2000 (human development index of municipality), we (survey weights). Municipality information is only available for four of the six surveys.

files.description: (Stata data file) This file is the same as the R Data file of similar name, except that it is provided in Stata Format. Contains selected variables from public opinion surveys taken close to the 2002 and 2006 elections. Includes the following variables: codeibge (official code of the municipality from which respondent was samples), vote (vote intention), income, partyID, educ (education level), sex, age,  region, surv (name and year of teh survey), hdi.2000 (human development index of municipality), we (survey weights).
files.label: _replic_20022006.tab

dataFile.description: (Stata data file) This file is the same as the R Data file of similar name, except that it is provided in Stata Format. Contains selected variables from public opinion surveys taken close to the 2002 and 2006 elections. Includes the following variables: codeibge (official code of the municipality from which respondent was samples), vote (vote intention), income, partyID, educ (education level), sex, age,  region, surv (name and year of teh survey), hdi.2000 (human development index of municipality), we (survey weights).

files.description: (PDF file) Explanation of the replication materials
files.label: Replication Instructions.pdf

dataFile.description: (PDF file) Explanation of the replication materials

files.description: (R Syntax File) This file contains code to re-analyze the LAPOP 2007 survey. It produces several tables in the paper and in the webappendix. We cannot make the data available, as it owned by LAPOP. However, once the data file is obtained, our analysis can be replicated using this file.
files.label: _replic.R

dataFile.description: (R Syntax File) This file contains code to re-analyze the LAPOP 2007 survey. It produces several tables in the paper and in the webappendix. We cannot make the data available, as it owned by LAPOP. However, once the data file is obtained, our analysis can be replicated using this file.

files.description: PDF file with additional details of the replication effort, and extended results not included in the main paper.
files.label: zucco&power2013_webappendix.pdf

dataFile.description: PDF file with additional details of the replication effort, and extended results not included in the main paper.
